meanings.sent1: Her art project was a duplicative of a famous painting.
meanings.sent2: The student's duplicative of the poem was so accurate.
meanings.sent3: The duplicative of his dance moves made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The duplicative of her handwriting was so precise.
meanings.sent5: The duplicative of the song was stuck in her head all day.

meanings.sent1: The duplicative task was boring but necessary.
meanings.sent2: The report had duplicative information that needed to be removed.
meanings.sent3: His duplicative jokes always made his friends smile.
meanings.sent4: The duplicative pattern on the fabric was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The duplicative sound of the clock ticking was soothing.

meanings.definition: Producing a duplicate or identical version
meanings.sent1: The duplicative key opened the locked drawer.
meanings.sent2: The machine created a duplicative copy of the document.
meanings.sent3: His duplicative attempt at baking cookies turned out perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The duplicative design on the shirt was popular among teenagers.
meanings.sent5: The duplicative photo looked exactly like the original.
